title: 820-3662 no green light
message:
Board is clean, no signs of liquid damage, PP3V42 is present
PPBUS_G3H was at 4V, no green light on charger 
R7121, R7122 both blown
I've replaced both resistors and U7100
Now PPBUS_G3H is 12.6V as normal but I still don't have a light on the charger and board won't start. Board seems to start in SMC bypass mode
SYS_ONEWIRE is 0.7v. I've tried replacing U7000 but no change.
Also tried reballing SMC, still no change.

Anything else I should try before I replace the SMC?
Thanks

title: 820-3662 no green light
message:
Post all U7000 voltages.
Did you try known good DCIN board?

title: 820-3662 no green light
message:
Hi, sorry just got back around to this board now. I've got the following at U7000

[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]1[/TD]
[TD]SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC[/TD]
[TD]3.416v[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]

[/TR]

[/TR]

[TD]SYS_ONEWIRE[/TD]
[TD]0.773V[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]5[/TD]
[TD]ADAPTER_SENSE[/TD]
[TD]0.716V[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][/TD]

[TD]r7029 1.98KOHM[/TD]
[TD][/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

I don't have another DC-board on hand for this model but I think the one I have is good. All the inductors/resistors seem to measure ok/low resistance and the little chip marked P7 doesn't seem blown (I've seen them burn up before)

title: 820-3662 no green light
message:
If you are sure about DCIN board, change SMC.

I first recommend to try removing TVS diode from DCIN board.
You cannot correctly diagnose a diode with the eye!

title: 820-3662 no green light
message:
you're right, I got a new DC-board from Amazon and boom, green light.

Sorry for wasting time, and thanks for the help
